snippet: At this year’s Oscar luncheon on Monday, nominees — or their films’ distributors — seemed to play down their chances of victory, avoiding any appearance of overconfidence.
abstract: Oscar nominees, or their films’ distributors, attending this year's Oscar luncheon are trying to play down their chances of victory and cast themselves as underdog in attempt to avoid any appearance of overconfidence.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: At this year’s Oscar luncheon on Monday, nominees — or their films’ distributors — seemed to play down their chances of victory, avoiding any appearance of overconfidence.

headline.seo: Academy Award Luncheon Talk: I’m an Underdog, Too
